availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Francis T. McKenney (Pendleton County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Pendleton County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Ransom McKenney and Nancy McKenney. Married to Mary F. McKenney in Pendleton County on February 27, 1855. Married to Lucy C. Forsythe McKenney in Pendleton County on January 20, 1858. Father of T. McKenney and Lauretta McKenney. Farmer in Pendleton County in 1860. Private in the 5th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (C.S.A.) from September 20, 1862, to September 10, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, District 1, p. 364B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, District 1, p. 250.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1910), KDLA, Roll #994052, Pendleton County Marriages.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Pendleton County Marriages, Film #000272798.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky: Confederate Kentucky Volunteers War 1861-65, vol. 2 (Frankfort: Legislature of Kentucky, 1915), 270-271.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1910), KDLA, Roll #994052, Pendleton County Deaths, p. 1.
